In an unexpected announcement, Google CEO Eric Schmidt has announced that as of today he will be stepping down from the captain's chair and will be replaced by co-founder Larry Page . official blog, Eric Schmidt said When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. He also added,`` Larry Page will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer
